CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In most reported cases , the band gaps of conjugated polymers are reduced by incorporating more thiophene units between the donor and the acceptor segments owing to the more extended and delocalized π-electron system. 49-51 However , it was interesting to notice that PIDT-C12NT , which has four thiophenes in each repeat unit , presented a simultaneous bathochromic shift of short wavelength absorption peak to 465 nm and hypsochromic shift of the long wavelength absorption peak to 593 nm along with increased relative intensity of the high and low - energy peaks. Analogous event has also been realized in D-A type of oligomers and polymers based on 3,4bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)thiophene or 2-ethylhexyloxy-substituted 3,4-propylenedioxythiophene as donor and BT as acceptor , which demonstrated that with the depleting composition of BT unit along the conjugated backbone , the dual absorbing bands were induced to move toward the maximum absorption ( λ max ) of the all - donor homopolymer that located in between of the dual absorbance. 52 In solid state , all polymers showed red - shifted absorption spectra compare to their solution absorption ( Figure 2b ) , which could be ascribed to the aggregation of polymer main chain. We realized a slightly bathochromic shift of the PIDT - DTNT absorbance relative to that of the PIDT - EHNT , which was in consistent with the trend realized in solution , while PIDT-C12NT showed a pronounced bathochromic shift of the low energy band absorption with λ max moved from 593 nm in solution to 619 nm as thin film. It was also worth noting that PIDT-C12NT showed much higher absorption coefficient than other two polymers in the whole visible area. Considering that high photo flux of solar spectrum within the region of about 550-700 nm , more intensified absorption of PIDT-C12NT indicated that more sunlight can be harvested that would potentially lead to higher J sc than the other two polymers. The optical band gaps of the polymers are in the range of 1.64 - 1.69 eV as estimated from the absorption onset and the detailed results are summarized in Table 1. Cyclic voltammetry ( CV ) measurements were carried out to evaluate the molecular frontier orbitals of the resulted polymers. The graphite , platinum wire , and Ag / AgCl were used as the working electrode , counter electrode , and reference electrode , respectively. Polymer films were casted from chlorobenzene solution with concentration of 8 mg mL -1 and all measurements were carried out under inert atmosphere. Figure 3 showed the oxidation of cyclic voltammograms of the polymer films on graphite disk electrode in tetrabutyl ammonium hexafluorophosphate ( Bu 4 NPF 6 ) solution ( 0.1 M in acetonitrile ) at a scan rate of 50 mV s^-1 .

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT-C12NT |
| PIDT-DTNT |
| PIDT-EHNT |
| BT |
| 3,4-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)thiophene |
| 2-ethylhexyloxy-substituted 3,4-propylenedioxythiophene |
| Bu4NPF6 |
| Acetonitrile |
| Chlorobenzene |

Note: Bu4NPF6 and acetonitrile are not polymers, but they are mentioned in the context of the CV measurements. Chlorobenzene is also not a polymer, but it is mentioned as the solvent used to cast the polymer films.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT-C12NT |
| PIDT-DTNT |
| PIDT-EHNT |
| BT |

Note: The entities "3,4-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)thiophene" and "2-ethylhexyloxy-substituted 3,4-propylenedioxythiophene" were not included in the table as they do not clearly refer to material names. They are mentioned in the context of the paragraph as components of the polymers, but they are not the names of the materials themselves.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In most reported cases , the band gaps of conjugated polymers are reduced by incorporating more thiophene units between the donor and the acceptor segments owing to the more extended and delocalized π-electron system. 49-51 However , it was interesting to notice that PIDT-C12NT , which has four thiophenes in each repeat unit , presented a simultaneous bathochromic shift of short wavelength absorption peak to 465 nm and hypsochromic shift of the long wavelength absorption peak to 593 nm along with increased relative intensity of the high and low - energy peaks. Analogous event has also been realized in D-A type of oligomers and polymers based on 3,4bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)thiophene or 2-ethylhexyloxy-substituted 3,4-propylenedioxythiophene as donor and BT as acceptor , which demonstrated that with the depleting composition of BT unit along the conjugated backbone , the dual absorbing bands were induced to move toward the maximum absorption ( λ max ) of the all - donor homopolymer that located in between of the dual absorbance. 52 In solid state , all polymers showed red - shifted absorption spectra compare to their solution absorption ( Figure 2b ) , which could be ascribed to the aggregation of polymer main chain. We realized a slightly bathochromic shift of the PIDT - DTNT absorbance relative to that of the PIDT - EHNT , which was in consistent with the trend realized in solution , while PIDT-C12NT showed a pronounced bathochromic shift of the low energy band absorption with λ max moved from 593 nm in solution to 619 nm as thin film. It was also worth noting that PIDT-C12NT showed much higher absorption coefficient than other two polymers in the whole visible area. Considering that high photo flux of solar spectrum within the region of about 550-700 nm , more intensified absorption of PIDT-C12NT indicated that more sunlight can be harvested that would potentially lead to higher J sc than the other two polymers. The optical band gaps of the polymers are in the range of 1.64 - 1.69 eV as estimated from the absorption onset and the detailed results are summarized in Table 1. Cyclic voltammetry ( CV ) measurements were carried out to evaluate the molecular frontier orbitals of the resulted polymers. The graphite , platinum wire , and Ag / AgCl were used as the working electrode , counter electrode , and reference electrode , respectively. Polymer films were casted from chlorobenzene solution with concentration of 8 mg mL -1 and all measurements were carried out under inert atmosphere. Figure 3 showed the oxidation of cyclic voltammograms of the polymer films on graphite disk electrode in tetrabutyl ammonium hexafluorophosphate ( Bu 4 NPF 6 ) solution ( 0.1 M in acetonitrile ) at a scan rate of 50 mV s^-1 .

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| λ max |
| absorption onset |
| optical band gap |
| J sc |
| molecular frontier orbitals |
| oxidation |
| reduction |
| cyclic voltammograms |
| scan rate |

Note: λ max refers to the wavelength of the maximum absorption peak. absorption onset refers to the onset of absorption in the spectra. optical band gap refers to the energy difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) of a material. J sc refers to the short-circuit current density. molecular frontier orbitals refer to the molecular orbitals that are involved in the electron transfer process during an electrochemical reaction. oxidation and reduction refer to the loss and gain of electrons by a material, respectively. cyclic voltammograms refer to the plot of current density versus potential for a cyclic voltammetry measurement. scan rate refers to the rate at which the potential is scanned during a cyclic voltammetry measurement.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Property name of material" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| λ max |
| absorption onset |
| optical band gap |
| J sc |

The following entities do not clearly refer to property names of materials and were removed:

* "molecular frontier orbitals"
* "oxidation"
* "reduction"
* "cyclic voltammograms"
* "scan rate"

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 465 nm | Bathochromic shift of short wavelength absorption peak of PIDT-C12NT |
| 593 nm | Hypsochromic shift of long wavelength absorption peak of PIDT-C12NT |
| 550-700 nm | Range of solar spectrum photo flux |
| 1.64-1.69 eV | Optical band gaps of the polymers |
| 8 mg mL-1 | Concentration of polymer films in chlorobenzene solution |
| 50 mV s^-1 | Scan rate of cyclic voltammograms |
| 0.1 M | Concentration of tetrabutyl ammonium hexafluorophosphate (Bu4NPF6) solution in acetonitrile |

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- | --- |

| 593 nm | Hypsochromic shift of long wavelength absorption peak of PIDT-C12NT |
